attachments.title: Winter Recipe: Rich and Meaty Lamb Ragù
attachments.text: We love rich, meaty ragù — especially in the depths of winter. It's such a treat poured over fresh pasta, or over fragrant rice. This particular recipe for rich lamb ragù is not hard to make, but you still get the benefits of long, slow cooking. The active part is over quickly, and then then the ragù sits and simmers all afternoon in the oven or all day in the slow cooker. The result is a deliciously heady sauce, and the fragrance of deeply browned meat simmering with half a bottle of red wine!
attachments.fallback: The Kitchn: Winter Recipe: Rich and Meaty Lamb Ragù

text: Swap the oven time for 45min at pressure. At the end I let it release naturally, then took the lid off and put it on sauté to reduce the liquid for about 10min
